A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Don't hesitate to give details or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer:

- All questionnaires
- Pioneer diet
- Pioneer schools
- Pioneer churches
- Pioneer recreation and social life
- Pioneer farming experiences
- Folklore in Saskatchewan
- Pioneer health and housing

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Provincial Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1924? What reasons did they have for moving?

Yes because many of them was not farmers they just merely homesteaded mortgaged and got out.

35. Did many people move away during the 1930s? Did many return?

Form word was I some moved back later

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

I am a member of the A.F.A.M. Lodge

Nov 1924 and now a life member

37. If you or any of your family or friends were first to have or do something in the district mention it here, giving dates whenever possible.

Such as owning the first automobile, combining the organizing first lodge, etc.

I was present at the organization of a F.A.O.S. at Yuma in Oct. 1919.

I had the first Combining in the District in 1949 and I am the first Settler in the Yuma district.

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (school districts, post offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name (2) origin and meaning of the name (3) date of its adoption (4) any changes in names since the first name was given, date and reason for change.

Our School district Beaver Hill derived its name from the Beavertails which adjoins it to the South. W. Grant & Co. Station was named by J. W. Grant discarded.
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1924? What reason did they have for moving?

Yes, occasional marriages of the young men and women who came in were not successful. They went "unmarried" homesteaded, married and got out.

35. Did many people move away during the 1900s? Did many return?

Some moved away and some moved back later.

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates whenever possible.

I am a member of the Ed. F. A. M. Lodge.

Nov. 1924 and now a life member.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were active in any organization, mention it here, giving dates whenever possible.

I was present at the organization of a F.A.O. at Utica in September 1928.

I had the first settlement in the Utica district in 1944 and I am the first settler in the Utica district.

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School districts, post offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name; (2) origin and meaning of the name; (3) date of its adoption; (4) any changes in name since the first name was given; date and reason for change. Give facts of new name as shown in (1), (2), (3).

Our school district Beaverkill changed its name from the Beaverkill school district to the Beaverkill school district adjacent to the Schoharie W. Grant School.

It was named by J. W. Grant, deceased.
